item.title: Disgruntled IT Worker Jailed for Cyber Attack, Huddersfield
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: The West Yorkshire Police provide today’s reminder of the insider threat and the need to terminate access and credentials before you terminate an employee’s employment: A disgruntled IT worker who launched a cyber attack on his employer after he was suspended from work has been jailed. Mohammed Umar Taj began to take revenge on his...

item.title: Hacker helped kill FBI sources, witnesses in El Chapo case, according to watchdog report
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Tim Starks reports: A hacker working on behalf of the Sinaloa drug cartel infiltrated cameras and phones to track an FBI official in Mexico investigating the drug lord El Chapo, then used data from that surveillance to kill and intimidate potential sources and witnesses the agent was meeting with, a Justice Department watchdog report revealed....

item.title: Texas Centers for Infectious Disease Associates Notifies Individuals of Data Breach in 2024
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Texas Centers for Infectious Disease Associates (TCIDA) has now issued a press release and sent notification letters to patients affected by an attack they first discovered last July. According to their notice, on July 19, 2024, they learned of unusual activity in their network. Their investigation determined that an unauthorized individual may have accessed or...

item.title: Battlefords Union Hospitals notifies patients of employee snooping in their records
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Today’s reminder of the insider threat comes to us from Battlefords Union Hospitals in Canada. Battlefords Now reports that between October 1, 2024 and April 4, 2025,Â an operating room scheduler accessed the MedAccess EHR system to look at personal and primary care medical information for hundreds of patients without a legitimate purpose. That same...

item.title: Northern Light Health patients affected by security incident at Compumedics; 10 healthcare entities affected
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Leela Stockley reports that a data security incident at a Northern Light Health vendor may have compromised some patients’ information. The vendor, Compumedics, provides sleep disorder diagnostic services for health system patients seen at Northern Light Eastern Maine Medical Center, Northern Light AR Gould, and Northern Light Sebasticook Valley Hospital. No report has appeared yet...

item.title: Privacy commissioner reviewing reported Ontario Health atHome data breach
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: CBC reports: Both Ontario’s privacy commissioner and Ontario Health are investigating a reported data breach affecting Ontario Health atHome,Â the province’s home-care coordination service. The incident may have exposedÂ personal health information forÂ at leastÂ 200,000 home-care patients, the Ontario Liberals allegedÂ in a news release Friday morning. The breach occurred on or around March 17 of this year but...

item.title: CMS warns Medicare providers of fraud scheme
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Naomi Diaz reports: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services isÂ warningÂ healthcare providers and suppliers about a new fraud scheme involving fake faxed requests for medical records. According to a June 26 alert posted on CMSâ€™ website, scammers are impersonating CMS and sending phishing faxes that falsely claim to be part of a Medicare audit. The...

item.title: Ex-student charged with wave of cyber attacks on Sydney uni
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Adam Vidler reports: A former student has been charged over a series of cyber attacks on aÂ SydneyÂ university that affected hundreds of staff and students. Since 2021, Western Sydney University had suffered a series of cyber hacks involving unauthorised access, data exfiltration, system compromise and misuse of university infrastructure â€“ including threatening the sale of student...

item.title: Detaining Hackers Before the Crime? Tamil Nadu’s Supreme Court Approves Preventive Custody for Cyber Offenders

item.description: The 420.in reports: The Supreme Court recently upheld the Tamil Nadu governmentâ€™s decision to invoke preventive detention laws against cybercriminals.
